subject: Re: [junit] Testing singleton patterns
msgSnippet: ... Yes, I feel we should carefully design what should be inject and what should be just create, I am maintaining a project that inject object everywhere, and
messageBody:
> In fact, it *is* a simple form of dependency injection - the injection
> is done by a hardcoded assembler (the "main method").
>
> A DI framework certainly can give you more flexibility. I don't think
> that's always needed. Anyway, when it's needed, it's still an elaborate
> from of JCO, as far as I can tell.
>
Yes, I feel we should carefully design what should be inject and what
should be just create, I am maintaining a project that inject object
everywhere, and how nearly hundred of XML configuration files. Not
easy to maintain and change.
